thread.title: Daredevils climb 770 feet to the top of Canary Wharf
thread.title_full: Daredevils climb 770 feet to the top of Canary Wharf

title: Daredevils climb 770 feet to the top of Canary Wharf
text: Share this article Share 'This is the second tallest building in London and we are going to try and get on the roof.' They then filmed themselves climbing the stairs and at one point setting off an alarm in a lift. At the top, the narrator, wearing a black hoodie, said: 'We have literally managed to get to the roof of the pyramid. This is insane. At the top, the narrator, wearing a black hoodie, said: 'We have literally managed to get to the roof of the pyramid. This is insane' 'I can't believe we are actually on here it is crazy. I feel like I am here so I need to touch the top of the building,' he said 'I can't believe we are actually on here it is crazy. I feel like I am here so I need to touch the top of the building. 'My heart is pounding. You can see the whole of London, just everything.' Then after climbing down, he added: 'Right guys, as you can see we are at the top of Canary Wharf, now we need to get down. Let's try and bag 30,000 likes.' A Metropolitan Police spokesman said: 'We are aware of footage online depicting people gaining unauthorised access One Canada Square. 'We will liaise with the building operators to assess whether any offences have been committed.' The man stretched out his arms while perching on the side of the pyramid. He said: 'My heart is pounding. You can see the whole of London, just everything' A Metropolitan Police spokesman said: 'We are aware of footage online depicting people gaining unauthorised access One Canada Square' Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
